Description: RARE VINTAGE SMITH MELOBAR ROSAC EASY PLAY 10 STRING ELECTRIC SUNBURST STAND UP SLIDE GUITAR W/ HARD CASE ~ S/N 5034 Up for auction is a rare, hard to find, Smith Mel-o-bar Rosac electric Sunburst stand-up slide guitar in excellent, near fine condition. It has little wear with dings in the surface on the back, the very top of the head stock, and the edge of the arm rest. The guitar is appx. 40" long. This particular model, the Rosac, was one of 200 Mel-o-bar guitars converted in Payette & Weiser, Idaho to be easy play guitars for beginners. It has the snap on fret guide, as shown in photo #6. It has the staggered pick-ups and on the fret board it reads: Sounds Fantastic Instruments, England, Canada, Japan, Fretboard copyright 1980, W.E. Smith, Melobar guitars 707 Weiser, Idaho. The guitar has been plugged into an amp using the cord that came with it and the playing sound is good through the speaker; both dials appear to function as expected. We do not have the experience or expertise to say fully what the playing quality of this instrument might have, therefore we are listing it as USED with LIMITED TESTING.Although this guitar was well liked by famous players, such as Jimmy Page, John Lennon, and the Rolling Stones throughout the 60's and 70's, many people did not believe the mel-o-bar to be anything special, and only until the mid-1980's did many find out about the unique qualities of this easy play stand up steel guitar, invented by Walt Smith. In the early 80's Walt's son, along with John Shelby, worked on the new versions on Walt's guitar, one being the wonderful guitar in this listing.Included with this package is the original hard case in good condition with keys, a nice strap with little wear, an amp cord, two fender picks, and a Speedbar metal finger slide. Also included is the original information sheet and the Melobar Guitar Course - Book One. Item #6115-9589 Please note: All items are sold "as is". Please check out our photographs to see more detail on any damage, etc. We are not experts, but we do our best to accurately photograph and describe our products and to answer any questions you may have. Hours of operation: We are open Monday-Friday, 8 am to 4:30 pm Mountain time. We are closed most major holidays. Return policy: All items are sold "as is", returns are not accepted. If we have misrepresented an item, please contact us and we will work toward a mutual solution. Payments, insurance, and shipping: We accept payments via PayPal only. Payment must be received within seven days of auction end. All items selling for more than $100 will be insured at our expense. We will combine multiple purchases to reduce shipping costs. We do our best to package all items securely to prevent any damage during shipping. Idaho sales tax and local pick-up: All items sold within the state of Idaho will include a 6% state sales tax on the invoice. Local pick-up at our Boise, Idaho main facility is available for all items at no cost. The Idaho Youth Ranch is a registered 501c3 nonprofit organization. Sales help support life changing programs to young people struggling with trauma, abuse, or homelessness. Promising Futures, Every Time You Shop.
